title.narrative: HIAS Community Based Sexual and Gender Based Violence Prevention and Response Program for Vulnerable Refugees in Kampala, Uganda

description.narrative: HIAS seeks to create opportunities of local integration for overlooked and vulnerable refugees by providing legal/protection, psychosocial and economic development opportunities. The target population is composed of communities who face multiple challenges accessing protection from or treatment for SGBV, who are socially marginalized, and who have special needs. The program will also aim to raise awareness of these populations’ needs among municipal, local service providers and civil society.

Objective 1: To provide psychosocial support – in individual and group settings - designed to alleviate trauma and related effects of sexual and other forms of violence in addition of the insecurity of searching for durable solutions in the host country. The interventions seek to strengthen coping skills, resiliency and knowledge particularly in prevention and response to SGBV.
Objective 2: To advance the well-being, self-reliance and integration of at-risk refugees through social and vocational services, outreach, education and other program activities. The goal is to improve community relations through awareness-building and partnership among host communities and refugees; engage and educate municipal and local service providers about refugee rights, potential and needs; and to develop and strengthen pathways and access to mainstream medical, education, vocational services with partnering organizations; to provide client graduates from external vocational training with micro grants to start livelihood opportunities
Objective 3: To build and strengthen the capacity of community mechanisms, national and local private and public organizations to address refugee population needs, build community relations, and improve the fulfillment of their rights and access to services.
